intro: Capillipedium parviflorum subsp. capiliflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered capillipedium, is a member of the Apiaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in umbels. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and often overlooked component of its native habitat.
